impact_weight: The reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can aid in the reduction of waste by promoting sustainable practices and reducing the need for landfills, which in turn can help achieve waste reduction targets.
Reducing pesticide use can lead to increased food waste due to crop losses, which can counteract efforts to reduce food waste.
Promoting competitive agriculture can enable the adoption of circular economy practices, such as recycling and reducing waste, in municipal waste management.
Protecting workers' rights and promoting fair labor practices can reinforce the responsible extraction and import of critical raw materials.
Ensuring food affordability can aid in reducing food waste by making healthy and sustainable food options more accessible to consumers.
Promoting healthy food options can enable the reduction of plastic packaging waste by encouraging sustainable packaging practices.

impact_subtheme: Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling
impact_weight: Reducing pesticide use can counteract efforts to promote the recycling of critical raw materials, such as those used in batteries, by limiting the availability of these materials.
